It was from my own Elizabeth:—

“My dearest Cousin,

“I have written myself into have written myself into have written myself into have written myself into have written myself into good good better good good spirits, dear spirits, dear spirits, dear spirits, dear spirits, dear cousin; cousin; cousin; Cousin cousin; yet I yet I but my anxiety returns upon me as I conclude. Write, dearest Victor,—one line—one word will be a blessing to us. Ten thousand thanks to Henry for his kindness, his affection, and his many letters: we are sincerely grateful. Adieu! my cousin; take care of yourself; and, I entreat you, write!
